title: Jessika Power 'invited Sam Burgess to attend the Maxim Hot 100 party' with her
text:
Fresh details have emerged about Married At First Sight star Jessika Power's flirty friendship with rugby league player Sam Burgess.

Daily Mail Australia understands that Power, 28, invited the South Sydney Rabbitohs prop, 30, to attend Thursday night's Maxim Hot 100 Halloween party as her guest.

Despite the tantalising offer, Burgess declined the invitation.

Flirty: Married At First Sight's Jessika Power (left, with Ines Basic) invited newly-separated NRL star Sam Burgess to attend Thursday night's Maxim Hot 100 Halloween party as her guest

It comes after Daily Mail Australia exclusively revealed that Burgess had been exchanging 'flirty' messages with Power over Instagram.

They started chatting just days after reports surfaced on October 13 that Burgess had separated from wife Phoebe, who is the mother of his two children, Poppy and Billy.

A source told Daily Mail Australia on Tuesday that Burgess had been 'bragging' to some of his friends about their exchanges and had even tried to 'line up a date'.

Glamour girl: Jessika appeared in the August edition of Maxim Australia, which featured model Olivia Caneva on its cover (pictured)

Bombshell: It comes after Daily Mail Australia exclusively revealed that Burgess (left) had been exchanging 'flirty' messages with Power (right) over Instagram

But despite sending 'flirty' messages, Power and Burgess do not appear to be following each another on Instagram.

Burgess' estranged wife is believed to be an avid fan of Married At First Sight, and even follows an Instagram fan page dedicated to the popular Channel Nine show.

Power declined to comment when contacted by Daily Mail Australia, and Burgess has not responded.

New friends: The South Sydney Rabbitohs prop struck up a friendship with the reality TV star (pictured) on Instagram earlier this month, Daily Mail Australia understands

Sam's new flame? A source claimed on Tuesday that Burgess had been 'bragging' to some of his friends about their exchanges and had even tried to 'line up a date' with Power (pictured)

The latest details come off the back of an eventful month for Burgess, who last week was pictured partying on a yacht in Cabo, Mexico, at former rugby league star turned pie entrepreneur Sean Garlick's 50th birthday party.

At one point, he was seen dancing with a bikini-clad woman on his shoulders, despite having a shoulder injury that could jeopardise his career.

During the festivities, Burgess wore a brown hat, a tribal-inspired necklace and a leopard print arm tie as he soaked up the sun on the luxury vessel.

Me Tarzan, you Jane: Burgess was pictured last week partying on a yacht in Cabo, Mexico at former rugby league star Sean Garlick's 50th birthday party

On October 19, Burgess was slapped with an AVO and banned from going within a kilometre of his estranged wife's father, Mitchell Hooke, following an argument between the two men at Mr Hooke's country estate near Bowral, NSW.

The altercation took place after Burgess had arrived at the premises to spend time with his two children: 10-month-old son Billy and two-year-old daughter Poppy.

Mr Hooke reportedly asked Burgess to leave the family's three hectare Glenquarry farm, which Burgess did, but police were called at about 5pm.

Officers filed an interim apprehended violence order (AVO) against Burgess, and court documents state he is now barred from coming close to the home.

Burgess is also banned from coming within a kilometre of any other place where Mr Hooke, a retired mining executive, lives or works.

Making headlines: On October 19, Burgess (right) was slapped with an AVO and banned from going within a kilometre of his estranged wife's father, Mitchell Hooke (left), following an argument between the two men at Mr Hooke's country estate near Bowral, NSW

He was also hit with standard AVO conditions which prevent him from stalking, intimidating or assaulting Phoebe's father.

A NSW Police spokeswoman told Daily Mail Australia that police are investigating and 'there are no reports of any injuries.'

Sam is due before Moss Vale Local Court on November 6, where a magistrate could confirm the AVO or dismiss it in its entirety.

There is no suggestion he did anything wrong by visiting the property. Phoebe was not at the farm during Burgess' weekend visit, with the pair having split weeks earlier.

Details: The altercation took place after Burgess visited the premises to spend time with his two children: 10-month-old son Billy and two-year-old daughter Poppy. Burgess is pictured at the property near Bowral before the incident with his father-in-law

It was first reported on October 13 that Phoebe and Sam Burgess had broken up for a second time, after they had initially separated in December before reconciling in April.

At the time, an insider told The Sunday Telegraph that Burgess had 'moved out several weeks' beforehand.

Burgess is said to have moved out of the couple's $3.8million marital home in Maroubra, while Phoebe is staying with her parents in the NSW Southern Highlands.

During their brief separation earlier this year, Sam had moved into celebrity accountant Anthony Bell's $11.5million Dover Heights mansion.

On and off: It was first reported on October 13 that Phoebe and Sam Burgess had broken up for a second time, after they had initially separated in December before reconciling in April. Pictured on September 27, 2017 at the Dally M Awards in Sydney

Separate ways: Burgess is said to have moved out of the couple's $3.8million marital home in Maroubra, while Phoebe (pictured) is staying with her parents in the NSW Southern Highlands

In April, Phoebe confirmed to Stellar magazine that she and Burgess had reconciled after their initial split in December, but admitted things weren't 'perfect'.

'Every person on this planet who is married knows it isn't perfect. It's never going to be perfect... Sam and I will have good days and we'll have trying days,' she said at the time.

Phoebe added that the reason for their split, and the details of their reconciliation, 'will always and forever just be between Sam and I'.

The Burgesses first met at an Avicii concert in Sydney in January 2014, and went on to marry at Phoebe's parents' estate in December 2015.
description: Fresh details have emerged about Married At First Sight star Jessika Power's flirty friendship with rugby league player Sam Burgess.
authors: Joshua Fox For Daily Mail Australia
